intro: Hemizonia multiglandulosa, commonly known as the many-glandular hemizonia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Hemizonia multiglandulosa is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
